title: chore(deps-dev): bump msw from 2.3.4 to 2.4.9

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [msw](https://github.com/mswjs/msw) from 2.3.4 to 2.4.9.
Release notes

Sourced from msw's releases.

v2.4.9 (2024-09-20)

Bug Fixes

  • ClientRequest: support Request as init when recording raw headers (#2293) (bf982eaa70ddd5d08706b8877ceb6c6c2517f660) @​kettanaito

v2.4.8 (2024-09-17)

Bug Fixes

  • address express and path-to-regexp vulnerabilities (#2285) (e3487bc4259368adc33739eb9490bde8421a215c) @​markmssd

v2.4.7 (2024-09-15)

Bug Fixes

  • ClientRequest: prevent duplicates when recording set headers (#2284) (e04eb8f44ffcf5ce755aa224d31a8576f4719a9f) @​kettanaito
  • use Object.defineProperty for Headers proxy (#2283) (94e17beea475a494c1de8b58ea399e518f55ddda) @​kettanaito

v2.4.6 (2024-09-13)

Bug Fixes

  • xhr: clone request body before calculating its size (#2282) (397444bcc386bbe560aa649460cb92cdb31d28a9) @​kettanaito

v2.4.5 (2024-09-11)

Bug Fixes

  • remove cookies with max-age=0 from cookie store (#2275) (c307ab27643fc80631d3f0a28e72f7339a54af70) @​kettanaito

v2.4.4 (2024-09-08)

Bug Fixes

  • fetch: follow mocked redirect responses (#2268) (f5785bfba1a026075feca4f74cadfcb636ffc257) @​kettanaito
  • Adopts a new, Socket-based request interception algorithm.

v2.4.3 (2024-09-07)

Bug Fixes

  • revert "graphql" as optional peer dependency (#2267) (7cd39e787aa9766eef914bce3d65daec1ce16635) @​kettanaito

v2.4.2 (2024-09-04)

Bug Fixes

  • cli: support windows paths in the init command (#2260) (ba285b887cedfa22f32ae1e8d6569e57174cb561) @​ivanfernandez2646 @​kettanaito
  • use typescript@4.8 as the minimal supported version (#2251) (6b2a7e6be8f9b63c2549ad7fbf271d38f803ad6e) @​THETCR @​kettanaito

... (truncated)

title: chore(deps): bump next from 14.2.4 to 14.2.13

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [next](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) from 14.2.4 to 14.2.13.
Release notes

Sourced from next's releases.

v14.2.13

[!NOTE]
This release is backporting bug fixes. It does not include all pending features/changes on canary.

Core Changes

  • Fix missing cache-control on SSR app route (#70265)
  • feat: add polyfill of URL.canParse for browser compatibility (#70228)
  • Fix vercel og package memory leak (#70214)
  • Fix startTime error on Android 9 with Chrome 74 (#67391)

Credits

Huge thanks to @​raeyoung-kim, @​huozhi, @​devjiwonchoi, and @​ijjk for helping!

v14.2.12

[!NOTE]
This release is backporting bug fixes. It does not include all pending features/changes on canary.

Core Changes

  • update prefetching jsdoc & documentation (#68047)
  • Ensure we chunk revalidate tag requests (#70189)
  • (backport) fix(eslint): allow typescript-eslint v8 (#70090)
  • [ppr] Don't mark RSC requests as /_next/data requests (backport of #66249) (#70083)

Credits

Huge thanks to @​alvarlagerlof, @​wyattjoh, @​delbaoliveira, and @​ijjk for helping!

v14.2.11

[!NOTE]
This release is backporting bug fixes. It does not include all pending features/changes on canary.

Core Changes

  • fix: correct metadata url suffix (vercel/next.js#69959)
  • fix: setting assetPrefix to URL format breaks HMR (#70040)
  • Update revalidateTag to batch tags in one request (#65296)

Credits

Huge thanks to @​huozhi, @​devjiwonchoi, and @​ijjk for helping!

v14.2.10

[!NOTE]
This release is backporting bug fixes. It does not include all pending features/changes on canary.

Core Changes

  • Remove invalid fallback revalidate value (vercel/next.js#69990)
  • Revert server action optimization (vercel/next.js#69925)
  • Add ability to customize Cache-Control (#69802)

Credits

Huge thanks to @​huozhi and @​ijjk for helping!

title: Fix badge link to point to the latest report
body:
### Description

The badge link currently does not point to the latest generated HealthCheck report. This issue could be related to caching or an outdated URL, but it should be fixed to ensure users always access the most recent results.

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19a556d8-e1fe-4132-8611-c3d92ccf5682)

link goes to this page:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/980d4a86-e6db-4129-9222-35d02349a033)

latest scan doesn't show up here either (may be related to manual scan):

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b6d05866-3367-4f48-b30c-fc523ebc8496)


### Additional information

I think this might have something to do with you running the scan manually.

Would expect the badge to go to the latest, or a selected report (maybe chosen by the user).

title: [FEATURE] Add check for Dependabot configuration file
body:
### Description

HealthCheck should check for a `.github/dependabot.yml` or similar configuration file to verify that repositories are using Dependabot for automated dependency updates. This will ensure project dependencies are consistently managed.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [FEATURE] Add check for issue templates
body:
### Description

HealthCheck does not validate the presence of issue templates in repositories. A check for `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/` would ensure repositories include standardized templates for issue reporting.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [FEATURE] Add check for SECURITY.md file
body:
### Description

HealthCheck currently does not check for the presence of a SECURITY.md file, which outlines the security policy for the repository. It would be useful to include a check for this file to ensure repositories have security guidelines.

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6f0c5c6e-cee4-4a23-8de9-e9d0eaeb4b8d)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/92d191dd-b082-4618-b46b-9b41a19ae1b4)

I got the idea from community standards

### Additional information

_No response_

title: Write automated test that creates a new user every time
body:
### Description

When the tests run on an existing DB, the user is no longer created but updated.

A bug was recently found when new users log in with GitHub OAuth, so we need to test the login for new users

1. This could be done by generating a random mock user
OR
2. Reset the DB everytime the tests run

I think option 1 is best, because we don't want to reset the DB in our local dev environment

Related issue https://github.com/EddieHubCommunity/HealthCheck/issues/243

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [FEATURE] Contributors check
body:
### Description

- min 3
- max 10

- `< min`: error
- `> min && < max`: warning
- `> max`: green 


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [FEATURE] Add explanations for why i have to do stuff
body:
### Description

So a lot of the issues is like `Do this`. But there is no explanation as to why, and what value i get from it:

I think this is important, since people need to know the purpose of doing things, if not, they won't do it.

A: What is the value i gain from doing it?
B: Give me examples of HOW to do it

So instead of:

`You should add some Topics. Try to include som topics`

it could be

`To increase the visibility of the repository, it's recommended to add at least five relevant topics that reflect the technology stack and business value of the project, such as #nextjs, #github, #nodejs, #webdevelopment, and #javascript.`

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [FEATURE] Mitigate number of clicks a user has to take to navigate around
body: ### Description Currently as a user i have to click `"My Repos" -> "renenielsendk / nextjs-api-typescript" -> " Error: 5, Warning: 1, Successful: 10"` to see the list of issues i am interested in. Why not just move the list of issues to the page that i navigate to from "My Repos". I would personally opt for something like one of the two below: ### Screenshots _No response_ ### Additional information _No response_

It's an inconvenience for the user if they click the button, and they are navigated away from the UI.

title: [FEATURE] Security section in report for OSSF Scorecard

labels.name: status: awaiting triage
labels.description: this issue is not ready for dev

body:
### Description

There is an API to query results for the repo

https://github.com/ossf/scorecard?tab=readme-ov-file

### Tasks
- docs: they must add the OSSF GitHub Action - can this be done with an api request from the app?
- check repo against the score card (there is a form, is there an API?)
- serverside: get+save API data as part of healthcheck run
- ui: display report results if exists

### Resources
- report https://scorecard.dev/viewer/?uri=github.com/EddieHubCommunity/HealthCheck
- api https://api.scorecard.dev/projects/github.com/EddieHubCommunity/HealthCheck

title: chore(deps-dev): bump eslint from 8.57.0 to 9.9.1

body:

Release notes

Sourced from eslint's releases.

v9.9.1

Bug Fixes

Documentation

title: fix: simplified mock oauth with mswjs
body:
<!-- If your PR fixes an open issue, use `Closes #999` to link your PR with the issue. #999 stands for the issue number you are fixing -->

## Fixes Issue

We are using mswjs for mocking github API requests, while writing a blog on it, I thought it might simplify our code if we used the same process for mocking authenticated users during testing (and for offline development or when there is no github oauth app)

<!-- Remove this section if not applicable -->

<!-- Example: Closes #31 -->

## Changes proposed

<!-- List all the proposed changes in your PR -->

[ ] - Not correct; marked as **not** done
-->

title: The add button is not disabled

labels.name: status: ready for dev
labels.description: this issue can be assigned and worked on

body:
### Description

Hello:)

I have noticed that without entering anything in the GitHub URL placeholder the button is still clickable. It should first test against a regex to see if there is a valid GitHub URL.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional information

If you are stuck and don't know the correct regex this should work:

```
^https:\/\/github\.com\/[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$
```
